titlepage.p: © 2008 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Sound recordings and transcripts of interviews conducted by Tatiana Zhilkina, relating to political conditions and especially to economic policy in the Soviet Union and Russian Republic. Includes some biographical materials on G. I. Fil'shin.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], G. I. Fil'shin interviews, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1998.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Sound recordings and transcripts of interviews conducted by Tatiana Zhilkina, relating to political conditions and especially to economic policy in the Soviet Union and Russian Republic. Includes some biographical materials on G. I. Fil'shin.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

did.unittitle: Sound recordings from a hotel in Moscow and answers to questions for Klub magazine

scopecontent.p: Part 1: Hotel in Moscow, 1989 August 4. Part 2: Answers to questions for Klub magazine, 1989 September 24. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006929
Part 1: Meeting at the ministry, 1991 May 30. Part 2: 1991 September 19. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006930
Part 1: Why was the Baikal-Amur railroad necessary? 1987 October 10. Part 2: On informal groups and local Soviets, 1988 November 2. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006931
Recorded in Vienna, Austria. Tape number 1. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006934
Recorded in Vienna, Austria. Tape number 2. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006933
Recorded in Vienna, Austria. Tape number 3. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006932
Part 1: 1988 November; Literaturnoe Obozrenie, 1989 July 1. Part 2: Continuation of Literaturnoe Obozreni, 1989 July 1. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006946

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Fil'shin speaking about himself and Baikal

scopecontent.p: Dates recorded are 1991 January 25, February 1, February 12, February 14. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006961

did.unittitle: Sovershenno sekretno and Dobryi vecher sound recordings

scopecontent.p: Part 1: Recording for Sovershenno sekretno, 1991 November 22 and 14 December. Part 2: Recording from the television show Dobryi vecher, Moskva with Shugaev, 1991 November 1. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006962
Part 1: Baikal, 1991 February 14. Part 2: Khabarovsk, 1991 December 19. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006970

did.unittitle: Sound recordings of television programs on Lithuania and Supreme Soviet

scopecontent.p: Recorded from television. Part 1: After the events in Lithuania, 1991 January 17. Part 2: Continuation of part 1 on Lithuania and proceedings of the Supreme Soviet, with a speech by Fil'shin, 1991 January 24. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006971
(1) 1989 October 8; (2) Ending of the book; (3) 1991 December 19; (4) Role of the party and mistakes, 1989 October 8; (4) 1989 October 13. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006974
Part 1: Speech, 1989 December 16. Part 2: Discussion, 1989 December 25; 1990 October 19. Use copy reference number: 98003_a_0006980
